alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Pierce; Wayne; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 1:34AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Glynn, eastern Pierce, Brantley, eastern Ware, Wayne and northeastern Charlton Counties through 200 AM EST... At 133 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Race Pond, or 14 miles northwest of Folkston, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jesup, Nahunta, Patterson, Gardi, Screven, Odum, Offerman, Hickox, Thalmann and Everett. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EST for southeastern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Pierce; Wayne; Western Charlton
